meanings.definition: A person who has recently risen to a position of power or prominence.
meanings.sent1: The upstarted quickly gained influence in the company.
meanings.sent2: The upstarted CEO impressed everyone with their leadership skills.
meanings.sent3: The upstarted manager made quite an entrance on their first day.
meanings.sent4: The upstarted politician shook up the established order.
meanings.sent5: The upstarted star shone brightly in the entertainment industry.

meanings.definition: To have suddenly begun or appeared.
meanings.sent1: The sun upstarted over the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent2: The idea upstarted in her mind during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat upstarted from behind the couch, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Laughter upstarted in the room, breaking the tension.
meanings.sent5: The music upstarted, filling the hall with its melody.

meanings.definition: To have started or risen abruptly.
meanings.sent1: The storm upstarted without warning, catching everyone off guard.
meanings.sent2: The price of the stock upstarted, causing excitement among investors.
meanings.sent3: The balloon upstarted into the sky, carried by the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her heart upstarted with joy when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The rocket upstarted into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.
